revised_title: Chernobyl Disaster: Analysis of Radionuclide Dispersal and Deposition Across Europe
tldr: This article analyzes the dispersal and deposition of radionuclides released from the Chernobyl nuclear power plant accident across Europe. The authors used computer models to study the meteorological conditions and interpret radiological measurements. They assessed the quantities of released nuclides and identified contaminated areas in Europe, estimating the collective dose to the population outside the USSR. The study provides an understanding of how contaminated air circulated across Europe and helped in interpreting the measurements taken after the disaster.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Environmental Pollution
